solution_line_template: The sum of mangoes, pears and pawpaws is {mangoes}+{pears}+{pawpaws} = <<{mangoes}+{pears}+{pawpaws}={sum_of_first_three_baskets}>>{sum_of_first_three_baskets}

The total number of fruits is {total_fruits} so the last two baskets contain {total_fruits}-{sum_of_first_three_baskets} = <<{total_fruits}-{sum_of_first_three_baskets}={fruits_in_last_two_baskets}>>{fruits_in_last_two_baskets} fruits

Each of the last two baskets contains an equal amount of fruits which is {fruits_in_last_two_baskets}/{number_of_last_baskets} = <<{fruits_in_last_two_baskets}/{number_of_last_baskets}={fruits_per_last_basket}>>{fruits_per_last_basket} fruits
